Title of each class &#160;&#160; Trading Symbol &#160;&#160; Name&#160;of&#160;exchange&#160;on&#160;which&#160;registered COMMON STOCK, $0.00000625 par value per share &#160;&#160; MSFT &#160;&#160; NASDAQ 3.125% Notes due 2028 &#160;&#160; MSFT &#160;&#160; NASDAQ 2.625% Notes due 2033 &#160;&#160; MSFT &#160;&#160; NASDAQ Indicate by check mark whether the registrant is an emerging growth company as defined in Rule 405 of the Securities Act of 1933 (&#167;230.405 of this chapter) or Rule 12b-2 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (&#167;240.12b-2 of this chapter). Emerging growth company &#9744; If an emerging growth company, indicate by check mark if the registrant has elected not to use the extended transition period for complying with any new or revised financial accounting standards provided pursuant to Section 13(a) of the Exchange Act. &#9744; &#160; &#160; Item&#160;5.07. Submission of Matters to a Vote of Security Holders On November&#160;30, 2021, Microsoft Corporation (the &#8220;Company&#8221;) held its 2021 Annual Shareholders Meeting (the &#8220;Annual Meeting&#8221;). There were 7,507,897,348 shares of common stock entitled to be voted at the Annual Meeting, of which 6,409,615,083 were voted in person or by proxy. The results for each item submitted for a vote of shareholders are as follows. The shareholders: (1) Voted to elect each of the twelve (12)&#160;nominees for director. (2) Approved, on an advisory basis, the compensation of the Company&#8217;s named executive officers. (3) Approved the Microsoft Employee Stock Purchase Plan (4) Voted to ratify the appointment of Deloitte&#160;&amp; Touche LLP as the Company&#8217;s independent registered public accounting firm for fiscal year 2022. (5) Rejected a shareholder proposal concerning a report on &#160; median pay gaps across race and gender. (6) Approved a shareholder proposal concerning a report on the effectiveness of workplace sexual harassment policies. (7) Rejected a shareholder proposal to prohibit sales of facial recognition technology to all government entities. (8) Rejected a shareholder proposal concerning a report on &#160; the implementation of the Fair Chance Business Pledge. (9) Rejected a shareholder proposal concerning a report on how lobbying activities align with Company policies. The Company&#8217;s inspector of election certified the following vote tabulations: Election of Directors &#160; Director &#160;&#160; Vote&#160;Results &#160; &#160;&#160; % Votes For &#160; &#160; For &#160; &#160;&#160; Against &#160; &#160;&#160; Abstain &#160; &#160;&#160; Broker Non-Votes &#160; Reid G. Hoffman &#160;&#160; &#160; Re-elected &#160; &#160;&#160; &#160; 99.41 %&#160; &#160; &#160; 5,168,833,028 &#160; &#160;&#160; &#160; 30,179,393 &#160; &#160;&#160; &#160; 6,874,892 &#160; &#160;&#160; &#160; 1,203,727,770 &#160; Hugh F.
